markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="">[Tar Zombie Predator](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1818)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

A big predator, like a smilodon or dire wolf, might lurk near a tar pit to pick off helpless creatures. When consumed and returned to unlife by a tar ooze, these tar zombie predators are just as canny and vicious.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 25

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 23

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 20
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 7">[Tar Zombie Predator](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1818)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="NE" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Large" />
<trait label="Mindless" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=108" />
<trait label="Undead" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=160" />
<trait label="Zombie" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=245" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #177: Burning Tundra](/Sources.aspx?ID=116) pg. 84</row>

**Perception** +15; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12)

**Languages**

**Skills**
[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +17, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +11

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +6

**Dex** +0

**Con** +4

**Int** -5

**Wis** +2

**Cha** -3
</row>

**Slow** A tar zombie is permanently [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35) and can't use reactions.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 23 

**Fort** +18 

**Ref** +11 

**Will** +15 

</row>

**HP** 180
([negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42))

**Immunities**
[death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38)

**Weaknesses**
[fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72) 10, [positive](/Traits.aspx?ID=128) 10, slashing 10

**Flammable** A tar zombie requires a successful DC 20 flat check to recover from [persistent fire damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29). This DC isn't reduced for assisted recovery.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 30 feet, climb 10 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
jaws +18,
**Damage** 2d10+10 bludgeoning plus [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=27)

**Tar-Spattered Charge** <actions string="Two Actions" />  The tar zombie predator lurches at its foe. It Strides twice and makes a claw Strike, or strides once and makes two claw Strikes. Both Strikes count toward its multiple attack penalty as normal. It can't make a Tar-Spattered Charge again for 1d4 rounds.

**Vomit Tar** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) The tar zombie vomits a gout of sticky tar in a 15-foot cone that deals 6d6 bludgeoning damage (DC 25 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). Creatures that fail the save are [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35) and gain fire weakness 5. Both conditions end after 3 rounds or when the tar is scrubbed off (which requires 3 Interact actions). The tar zombie can't Vomit Tar again for 1d4 rounds.

</column>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-303" />
name: Tar Zombie Predator

When consumed and returned to unlife by a tar ooze, these tar zombie predators are just as canny and vicious. This DC isn't reduced for assisted recovery. --- Speed 30 feet, climb 10 feet Melee Single Action jaws +18, Damage 2d10+10 bludgeoning plus Improved Grab Tar-Spattered Charge Two Actions The tar zombie predator lurches at its foe. It Strides twice and makes a claw Strike, or strides once and makes two claw Strikes. Both Strikes count toward its multiple attack penalty as normal. It can't make a Tar-Spattered Charge again for 1d4 rounds. Vomit Tar Two Actions (Evocation, Primal) The tar zombie vomits a gout of sticky tar in a 15-foot cone that deals 6d6 bludgeoning damage (DC 25 basic Reflex save). The tar zombie can't Vomit Tar again for 1d4 rounds.
